resources.string:
Credits are accessed by long clicking a riddle title. The list-item will be highlighted in gold once it has been completed (also, long click a riddle text or title in order to check whether it has been solved).

Checks, cash, and bitcoin will be accepted for tips, hints, or answers.

Feedback is appreciated.

The source is hosted on github: https://github.com/exorableludos/devinettes-android.

It is prohibited to distribute these riddles commercially.

Contact the riddlers at: exorable.ludos@gmail.com

string-array.name: riddles
string-array.item:
It walks on four legs in the morning
Two legs in the afternoon
And three legs at night.
What is it?

Without this common currency,
Cries are quieted, food is bland,
All light will lose transparency
And numbness stuns your hand.

When there is one, it is stood up 
When there are two, they've both been true 
When there are seven, it is creation 
When they've past, their record lasts.

My warmth connects from far to wide,
Nevertheless, I too divide.
I am the greatest of my kind;
My value, zero, will never rise.

What coat or crust is always worn
In winter when my hair has shed
And blossom season, when I'm warm
And hair's again atop my head.

My dearest vexxed, where, close at hand,
Do suited men mean royalty,
Where one defector from the band
May forfeit all their quality?

What ancient war, played out in duels,
Though set aside, is never won,
Despite the fall of kings to fools
And tragically neglected pun?

Found in heaps of equine cuisine.
You poke my eye and guide me well,
Led beneath, lest my mark be seen.
I wound! Yet heal! None need tell.

Without you I am incomplete
You, the earthÂ´s most tasteful treasure,
I, the opposite of sweet
In harmony we come together.

Without you I am incomplete
You dry your tears and come ashore
You white, I black, at last we meet
Better to wed than to be pure.

What's the secret to this question
Which seems to mean to little?
You think you know but think again,
The answer is a riddle.

This: brought by man into the world,
Thing unthinkable, yet present:
Nor God, nor Love, nor Mind unfurled,
The trick? The answer isn't.

Name your heroine after me
Or count your chances, set her free.
Or make a chain to bind her near
My life is short, your love is dear.

Name me the skin you cannot touch
Nor taste so long as five is five
Which fills the fields -- we call them such --
We spectate all our waking lives.

Recursion here where wont was more:
Mask without a face, coin without wealth.
Now the think you're looking for
Is nothing other than itself.

Name me the house without window,
The oldest kind, with but one room.
There you'll find me in the shadow,
Waiting for my soul to bloom.
